headlines: Blowout NFP (130k vs exp 65k) pushes first Fed cut to July, but BLS revisions (-862k) and sector concentration raise sustainability concerns
UK GDP disappoints (0.1% m/m vs exp 0.1%, but 0.7% y/y vs exp 1.1%) as Manufacturing Production falls -0.5%
Trump-Xi trade truce reportedly extended to 1 year at April Beijing summit, but Trump privately considering exiting USMCA
China announces 11.7% tariff on EU dairy products effective Feb 13th in escalating trade tensions

USD.summary: Dollar failed to sustain post-NFP gains despite blowout headline (130k vs exp 65k, unemployment 4.3% from 4.4%). BLS revisions (-862k through March 2025) and sector concentration (private payrolls +172k, but job losses in retail, construction, manufacturing, tech, financials) raise sustainability concerns. Fed's Schmid sees breakeven employment at 40-50k. First cut now priced July (prev. June). Weak 10yr auction (1.4bps tail, largest since Aug 2024) pressured Treasuries. DXY choppy, awaiting CPI (Fri).
headlines: NFP 130k vs exp 65k, unemployment 4.3%
BLS revisions -862k through March 2025
Fed's Schmid: breakeven employment 40-50k

EUR.summary: Euro lacked conviction after returning to sub-1.1900 territory. ECB officials called for additional EU debt (Nagel: new reality requires more EU debt, sees benefits of Euro-wide benchmark safe asset). ECB Wage Tracker rose to 2.388% (prev. 2.316%). Von der Leyen said EU needs one large, deep, liquid capital market (currently too fragmented). Italian Industrial Production 3.2% y/y (prev. 1.4%). EUR/USD rangebound, awaiting fresh catalysts.
drivers: ECB Calls for More EU Debt
headlines: ECB's Nagel: new reality requires more EU debt
ECB Wage Tracker 2.388% (prev. 2.316%)
Italian Industrial Production 3.2% y/y

GBP.summary: Sterling under pressure after weak UK GDP data. GDP m/m 0.1% (in line), but GDP y/y 0.7% vs exp 1.1% (prev. 1.2%). Manufacturing Production m/m -0.5% vs exp 0.0% (prev. 1.9%). Industrial Production m/m -0.9% vs exp 0.0% (prev. 1.3%). Construction Output m/m -0.5% vs exp 0.5%. Prelim Business Investment q/q -2.7% vs exp -0.5%. Data signals UK economic weakness persists despite political stabilization. GBP/USD struggled for direction, awaiting BoE signals.
drivers: Weak GDP Data (0.7% y/y vs exp 1.1%)
headlines: UK GDP y/y 0.7% vs exp 1.1%
UK Manufacturing Production m/m -0.5%
UK Business Investment q/q -2.7%

JPY.summary: Yen outperformed after sharp USD/JPY reversal sparked intervention speculation. USD/JPY initially jumped to 154.64 post-NFP, then reversed entire move to 152.84 within minutes. However, intervention unlikely: 1) Japan typically intervenes on JPY-favorable US data, not against narrative, 2) Government not sitting, 3) Japan on holiday. Top currency diplomat Mimura: watching markets with high sense of urgency, in contact with US authorities. Japan requested US Fed/NY Fed JPY rate check in January. Nikkei 225 hit fresh record above 58,000 before fading. PPI in line (0.2% m/m, 2.3% y/y).
headlines: USD/JPY sharp reversal sparks intervention speculation
Mimura: watching markets with high sense of urgency
Japan requested US Fed JPY rate check in January

AUD.summary: Aussie erased all NFP-induced USD strength, supported by hawkish RBA rhetoric. Governor Bullock: Board decided inflation at around 3-point something was unacceptable, Bank will monitor data and act if inflation becomes entrenched, warning further rate hikes may be needed. Deputy Gov Hauser: Economy is not just 'dig it and ship it', many parts of economy doing quite well. ASX 200 led higher by utilities and financials (Origin Energy, ANZ Group rallied post-earnings). Copper bid higher on nickel supply concerns (Indonesia's Weda Bay mine told to slash output 70%). AUD/USD resilient despite strong NFP.
headlines: RBA's Bullock: inflation at 3-point something unacceptable
RBA's Hauser: many parts of economy doing quite well
Copper rallies on Indonesia nickel mine output cut

CAD.summary: Loonie weakened on Bloomberg report that Trump is privately considering exiting the North American trade pact, asking aides why he shouldn't withdraw. White House called it baseless speculation, but injected uncertainty into pivotal renegotiations. USD/CAD hit highs of 1.3619 before paring to 1.3570. BoC Minutes: Governing Council agreed policy interest rate was on stimulative side, need to maintain optionality. Crude prices firmer (WTI +$0.67 to $64.63, Brent +$0.60 to $69.40) on Middle East tensions (Trump weighs second carrier if Iran talks fail). Trump-Xi trade truce reportedly extended 1 year.
headlines: Bloomberg: Trump privately considering exiting USMCA
BoC Minutes: policy rate on stimulative side
Crude rallies on Middle East tensions

CHF.summary: Franc underperformed as traders unwound recent carry trade-related strength, potentially returning to JPY. CHF weakened given risk tone and as markets repositioned post-NFP. SNB policy stable. Swiss sight deposits data awaited. CHF lost safe-haven premium as geopolitical tensions (Middle East, Russia-Ukraine) took backseat to NFP reaction. EUR/CHF and USD/CHF rangebound.
headlines: CHF underperforms on carry trade unwind
Traders potentially returning to JPY
Risk-on tone weighs on safe-haven demand

NZD.summary: Kiwi tracked AUD higher, benefiting from broad risk-on tone and hawkish RBA spillover. NZD/USD erased NFP-induced weakness alongside AUD. No fresh domestic catalysts, but high-beta characteristics supported gains. China stimulus hopes persist (PBoC appropriately loose policy, Premier Li urges AI use in various sectors). Trump-Xi trade truce reportedly extended 1 year at April Beijing summit, reducing near-term trade war risk. NZD supported by commodity strength (copper, gold).
headlines: NZD tracks AUD higher on hawkish RBA spillover
Trump-Xi trade truce reportedly extended 1 year
China Premier Li urges AI use in various sectors

FGBL.name: Euro Bund Future (Germany 10Y)
FGBL.summary: Bund futures took a breather after Wednesday's whipsawing. ECB's Nagel called for more EU debt (sees benefits of Euro-wide benchmark safe asset), while Schnabel noted numerous headwinds for German economy (potential growth weighed by demographic change). German dual-tranche tap (EUR 750mln 2.90% 2056, EUR 1.16bln 2.50% 2054) showed mixed demand. Bunds dragged lower post-NFP to lows of 128.39, but pressure short-lived, recovering to near-unchanged. Awaiting US CPI (Fri) for direction.
drivers: ECB Calls for More EU Debt

ZN.name: US Treasury 10Y Note Future
ZN.summary: Treasury prices plummeted post-NFP (T-note futures 112-19+ to 112-00), but pared majority of move before weak 10yr auction capped reversal. Auction showed 1.4bps tail (largest since Aug 2024), bid-to-cover 2.39x (prev. 2.55x), indirect demand fell to 65.4% (prev. 70.2%), leaving dealers with above-average 13.4%. At settlement, 10yr yield +3.1bps at 4.176%. First Fed cut now priced July (prev. June), but two cuts still priced by year-end. Fed's Schmid: appropriate to keep restrictive policy with inflation near 3%. Attention turns to CPI (Fri). 30yr bond auction due Thu.
